slides.title: Kachina Painter
slides.caption: An avid painter of local cultures, Eanger Irving Couse moved to Taos with his family where he was a painter of Native Americans until his death in 1936. “Kachina Painter” is only one of many of his works.

slides.title: Pueblo Feast Day
slides.caption: Christian saints adopted during the Colonial conquest are honored during Feast Days, along with dances to maintain harmony with the natural world. This occasion (“Pueblo Feast Day”) in particular is satirical, with Bill and Hillary Clinton, artist Georgia O’Keeffe, and Tonto (Lone Ranger’s sidekick) gathered around the table.
